comments.body:
I think it will be better to have an activation script that sets `RABBITMQ_HOME` env variable.

See https://github.com/conda-forge/openjdk-feedstock/blob/master/recipe/build.sh#L35-L38 and https://github.com/conda-forge/openjdk-feedstock/tree/master/recipe/scripts for an example.

@isuruf,
I thought that initially as well. Digging deeper into the rabbitmq-env script showed that it is doing its own logic to find out RABBITMQ_HOME. I decided to follow the path used in the Debian/Ubuntu.
Okay. In that case you might want to change `${PREFIX}` to `${CONDA_PREFIX}` because `PREFIX` is only set in a conda build environment and not in a normal conda environment.
PREFIX is being expanded during install time at recipes/rabbitmq/build.sh:27, is that okay with you?
